page.title: 16ASHILL CLUBS (4)
page.content: The{Golden Link}is a club for retired people, meetings are held in the Community Centre on Thursday afternoons. The{Community Centre}is the hub of most village activities and has its own management committee, built in 1980 for a cost of Â£56,000. This summer an extra room was built, called the "Upton" room after a generous donation from a committee member of that name. The cost of this room was Â£5,800. The village is well served by a magazine called{ASHLINK}in which the clubs, businesses etc advertise and report on their affairs. {Ashill Village Aid}have recently opened a{Community Call-in}serving lunches, teas etc. and provide help to the villagers with any problems including transport, chiropody etc.
